frame.name: Medical_professionals
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame includes words that name medical professionals and is closely related to the Medical_specialties frame. The FE <fen>Type</fen> characterizing a <fen>Professional</fen>'s sub-specialty may also be expressed.
<ex>Ralph is a <fex name="Prof"><t>paediatrician</t></fex>.</ex> <ex><x><fex name="Type">Paediatric</fex> <fex name="Prof"><t>oncologists</t></fex></x> <gov>treat</gov> children with leukemia.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Type
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Type</fen> of medical professional. <ex><x><fex name="Type">Paediatric</fex> <t>oncologists</t></x> <gov>treat</gov> children with leukemia.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Professional
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the medical <fen>Professional</fen>. <ex><x>Paediatric <fex name="Prof"><t>oncologists</t></fex></x> <gov>treat</gov> children with leukemia.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Affliction
FE.definition:
<def-root>The particular disorder that the medical <fen>Professional</fen> treats. Most words in the frame inherently indicate this information.
<ex><fex name="aff">Cardiac</fex> <t>gerontologists</t> can make more money in a year than I 'll see in my life !</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Body_system
FE.definition:
<def-root>The part of the body that the medical <fen>Professional</fen> treats. This is usually indicated by the Lexical Unit itself.
<ex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Age
FE.definition: <def-root>The length of time the <fen>Professional</fen> has been alive.</def-root>

FE.name: Compensation
FE.definition: <def-root>The payment that the <fen>Professional</fen> recieves for working.</def-root>

FE.name: Contract_basis
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Contract_basis</fen> describes the conditions of employment with respect to permanency, hours per time period, or payment basis.</def-root>

FE.name: Employer
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Employer</fen> gives compensation to the <fen>Professional</fen> for working.</def-root>

FE.name: Ethnicity
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Ethnicity</fen> is the religious, racial, national, socio-economic or cultural group to which the <fen>Professional</fen> belongs.</def-root>

FE.name: Rank
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Rank</fen> is the position in a hierarchy that the <fen>Professional</fen> occupies within an organization.</def-root>

FE.name: Origin
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Origin</fen> is the place where the <fen>Professional</fen> was born or lived a salient part of her or his life.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: physician.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person qualified to practise medicine, especially one who specializes in diagnosis and medical treatment as distinct from surgery

lexUnit.name: surgeon.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a medical practitioner qualified to practise surgery

lexUnit.name: allergist.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a doctor who specializes in the diagnosis and treatment of allergies.

lexUnit.name: doctor.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person who is qualified to practise medicine

lexUnit.name: cardiologist.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a doctor who specializes in the diseases and abnormalities of the heart

lexUnit.name: anesthesiologist.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a doctor who specializes in anesthesiology

lexUnit.name: chiropractor.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a practitioner of chiropractics

lexUnit.name: dermatologist.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a doctor who specializes in diseases of the skin

lexUnit.name: endocrinologist.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a doctor who specializes in the glands and hormones of the body and their related disorders

lexUnit.name: gastroenterologist.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a doctor who specializes in diorders of the stormach, intestines, and related organs

lexUnit.name: gerontologist.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a doctor who specializes in the phenomena associated with old age and aging

lexUnit.name: homeopathist.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a healthcare provider who practices homeopathy

lexUnit.name: immunologist.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a doctor who specializes in the disorders and the functioning of the immune system

lexUnit.name: neonatologist.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a doctor who specializes in conditions and disorders of newborns

lexUnit.name: nephrologist.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a doctor who specializes in the disorders and functioning of the kidneys

lexUnit.name: neurologist.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a doctor who specializes in the nervous system and disorders affecting it

lexUnit.name: obstetrician.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a physician or surgeon qualified to practise in obstetrics

lexUnit.name: gynaecologist.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a physician or surgeon who deals with women's sexual and reproductive systems and the disorders associated with them

lexUnit.name: oncologist.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a physician or surgeon who specializes in cancer

lexUnit.name: orthopaedist.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a physician or surgeon who specializes in the skeletal system and conditions and disorders affecting it

lexUnit.name: pediatrician.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a physician or surgeon who deals with children's health and illnesses

lexUnit.name: proctologist.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a physician or surgeon who specializes in diseases affecting the rectum, colon, and anus

lexUnit.name: psychiatrist.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a medical practitioner specializing in the diagnosis and treatment of mental illness

lexUnit.name: psychoanalyst.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a medical professional who practices psychoanalysis

lexUnit.name: radiologist.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a physician or surgeon who specializes in radiology

lexUnit.name: rheumatologist.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a physician or surgeon who deals with the treatment of rheumatic disease

lexUnit.name: family_practitioner.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a medical doctor who specializes in the care of people of all ages

lexUnit.name: therapist.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a medicial practitioner trained in methods of diagnosis and rehabilitation other than the use of drugs or surgery

lexUnit.name: ophthalmologist.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a physician who specializes in the structure, functions and diseases of the eye

lexUnit.name: radiation_oncologist.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a physician or surgeon who specializes in radiology for the treatment of cancer

lexUnit.name: midwife.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a nurse who is trained to assist women in childbirth.

lexUnit.name: psychologist.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person trained and educated to perform psychological research, testing, and theraphy

lexUnit.name: psychotherapist.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a medical practitioner specializing in the diagnosis and treatment of a mental or emotional condition

lexUnit.name: shaman.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person regarded as having access to, and influence in, the world of good and evil spirits, especially among some peoples of northern Asia and North America.

lexUnit.name: urologist.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a physician who deals with problems and diseases of the urogenital tract

lexUnit.name: speech_therapist.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a medical professional specializing in the diagnosis and rehabilitation for development of and disorders in speech, language and the organs used in speech

lexUnit.name: nurse.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person trained to care for the sick or infirm.
